content: this is a legal case that took place in the municipal court of pazin the coownership petitioner and the counterparty who own a property together have decided to dissolve their coownership the petitioner will become the sole owner of the property and is required to pay the counterparty their share of the propertys value which amounts to 26832 kuna this payment must be made within 15 days the land registry department is ordered to register the petitioner as the sole owner of the property the court used specific laws to make this decision the property in question is a neglected pasture located near a village the petitioner wants sole ownership because accessing the property is not possible without crossing the petitioners other properties various documents were reviewed to determine ownership and property characteristics the court considered data from the tax administration to determine the market value of the property based on this data the court determined the counterpartys share and the amount the petitioner must pay the coownership is dissolved and the petitioner will compensate the counterparty with a payment of 26832 kuna the counterparty will have a lien on the property based on their share
